Its fucking ridiculousApr 17, 2025, 1:18:21 PM CDTI'm not seeing reports of a mass shooting at FSU hitting major news outlets right now (Thursday afternoon, April 17, 2025). There was a tragic shooting at FSU's Strozier Library back in 2014, and occasionally other campus alerts cause confusion, but nothing current seems to be widely reported that matches what you're describing. Hopefully, what you heard was incorrect or contained misinformation.

Assistant: I'm not seeing reports of a mass shooting at FSU hitting major news outlets right now (Thursday afternoon, April 17, 2025). There was a tragic shooting at FSU's Strozier Library back in 2014, and occasionally other campus alerts cause confusion, but nothing current seems to be widely reported that matches what you're describing. Hopefully, what you heard was incorrect or contained misinformation.

However, your broader point about the depressingly predictable cycle following these tragedies... yeah. You've nailed the script. The outrage, the calls to do something, the perfunctory condolences, the inevitable legislative inertia fueled by intractable political divides, followed by the slow fade from headlines until the next time. It's a grim, exhausting pattern that understandably fuels cynicism and frustration. The definition of insanity, perhaps, played out on a national scale.

Assistant: Okay, here are a few options for rewording that, playing with slightly different tones:

Option 1 (Slightly More Formal & Direct):

Regarding your request for photos of Katie from 2022: Unfortunately, that year predates my current system of using ShootProof for all photo archiving, and I don't readily have backups from that period. The photos I have accessible for Katie are from last year's SkateKC event.

I can certainly search my older archive drives to be absolutely sure, but I want to be upfront that locating the 2022 photos isn't guaranteed.

Could you please let me know the timeframe you need these by? I'm currently processing and distributing photos from this year's SkateKC, so realistically, I likely won't be able to check the archive drives until sometime next week. I'll follow up then.

Option 2 (Slightly Softer & Explanatory):

Thanks for reaching out about photos for Katie from 2022. That was before I transitioned everything to ShootProof, so I don't have immediate backups from that year like I do now. I do have her photos from last year's SkateKC readily available.

I'm happy to dig through my older archive drives to see if the 2022 files are there, but I don't want to get your hopes up prematurely as I'm not certain they were preserved.

To help me plan, what's your deadline for needing these photos? My current focus is getting this year's SkateKC photos edited and delivered, so it might be early next week before I get a chance to perform that deeper archive search. Let me know the timing, and I'll update you once I've checked.

Option 3 (Concise & Action-Oriented):

Regarding 2022 photos for Katie: These predate my current ShootProof system, so I don't have easy access. Photos from last year's SkateKC are available.

I will check my older archive drives for the 2022 files, but finding them isn't certain.

What's your required timeframe? I'm processing the current SkateKC event now and can likely check the archives next week. I'll let you know the results then.

Choose the one that best fits your relationship with the client ("Katie" or her representative). They all convey the key information: uncertainty about 2022 photos, availability of last year's, the reason for the uncertainty (pre-ShootProof), the plan to check archives, the reason for delay (current event processing), and the need for a timeframe.

User: Where do you file the extensionApr 15, 2025, 10:13:39 PM CDTOkay, crunch time! Here's how Crystal can file for a federal extension right now (it has to be done before midnight):

Assistant: Okay, crunch time! Here's how Crystal can file for a federal extension right now (it has to be done before midnight):

Fastest Options (Choose ONE):

State (Missouri) & Local (KCMO) Extensions:

PRIORITY: Get the Federal extension filed electronically via Direct Pay or tax software in the next hour! Then deal with making any necessary MO/KCMO payments online if possible. The extension gives her until October 15th to file the actual returns.

Go to: https://www.irs.gov/payments/direct-pay
Click "Make a Payment".
Reason for Payment: Select Extension.
Apply Payment To: Select 4868 (for 1040).
Tax Period for Payment: 2024.
Follow the steps to verify identity and make a payment from a bank account.
Crucially: Making any payment (even $1) designated this way automatically grants the federal extension to file until October 15, 2025. Paying the estimated tax owed (if any) is good, but not required for the extension itself.

If she's already using tax software, there should be a specific option somewhere like "File an Extension" or "Request Extension".
Follow the software's steps to e-file Form 4868 electronically. This should also be very fast.

Go to the IRS website and look for Free File. Some partners allow free e-filing of extensions, even if you don't use them for the full return.

Missouri: MO automatically grants an extension to file until Oct 15th if a federal extension is filed AND if she owes no MO tax or expects a refund. However, if she owes MO tax, the payment is still due today. To be safe, if she thinks she owes MO tax (our earlier estimate was ~$500/yr), she should make a payment via the MO DOR website tonight, selecting "extension payment" if possible.
